characters: I really have to go now
Do you want to come to the masquerade
I really need to talk to you

dialogue.text: Welcome back to the vampire channel Blood, Sweat, Tears.
Sensitive viewers are warned about parties, bad jokes
and unfortunately way too little smut for a vampire series.
This is Skaraborg High School.
Here you’ll find beauty queens, emos, jocks, and troublemakers,
and the gossip spreads faster than the school Wi-Fi.
There I am! No, to the right—in the mascot costume.
Life is unfair. But everything’s here:
Teenage feelings, teenage feelings,
Sweden’s best kebab sauce, the school’s rice kids.
Relax. It’s just a regular math book. Nothing else.
Baddies with high body counts, insanely much makeup
and nerds with sky-high high scores.
At this school rumors spread faster than a virgin comes.
And speaking of coming!
Here come the number-one party planners, with an IQ roughly on the same level.
So get ready for a new term of Blood, Sweat, Tears.
And to not miss anything, subscribe to my channel.
I, your very own vampire researcher, am ready with brand-new equipment.
Like! Follow!
–Hey, Alfred. –Yo, Mr. Beast.
How’s it going? Have you hit your 20th follower yet?
A vampire is starting at our school. How cool is that?
I went and donated blood to the Blood System just for today.
Imagine! My blood will be eaten by the vampires to keep them calm.
–Together we save lives.
dialogue.speaker: And remember

dialogue.text: They eat our blood and in return their blood becomes medicine for us.
Humans and vampires side by side.
But one misstep and they get triggered and bloodthirsty.
Today is the day we’ve all been waiting for,
when the vampire finally steps out of the shadows.
Is it pale? Is it 200 years old? Is it as powerful as Dracula?
And above all: How big are the fangs?
Hi!
So many questions and I’m going to find the answers.
See it? Or? That’s the new vampire.
What?
–It’s fucking disgusting. –Yeah, I think so too.
–Yeah.
dialogue.speaker: Got any gum

dialogue.text: Take another one then. Stinky!
How’s the vampire going to manage among bandy guys and dance girls?
Here it’s not good grades that matter.
The absolute most important thing is how good you are at your sport
and above all that you contribute to the Skaraborg Bats trophy cabinet.
The guys are rock-hard and the girls are as blonde
as their acrylic nails are sharp.
They call themselves Batgirls. Ironically, since they love high UV.
This is humor, horror and drama.
This is Skaraborg High School. This is Blood, Sweat, Tears.
And we’re kicking off with our novella analyses.
–But first… –I wouldn’t count on it.
Chloe…
Put the phone away.
First I’d like to introduce your new classmate Kiara.
Can you tell us a bit about yourself?
Good morning! My name is Kiara Natt och Dag.
Welcome to us! And I’d like to remind everyone
that the politically correct term is cold-blooded.
We don’t use the V-word.
It’s very important here now that no one offends Kiara
because she’s a vampire.
Cause we are young, wild, we are free
BST!
It's just the way that it's supposed to be
BST!
Good morning… Good morning! My name is Jonas, your substitute today.
Got called in at 02:00, so I’m not in the greatest mood.
But as you know we’ve got a vampire in the class,
so the school has decided to install this kind of emergency vampire kit.
They get triggered by blood and sweat.
So you, chubby, maybe shouldn’t stand so close.
Triggered means they go completely hysterical.
Like some people maybe get once a month.
But like this, you should absolutely not try this,
but I’m going to do it just to be safe.
I pull it in and then…
Then you feel good.
Just press it against her face
when she gets a bit crazy.
Just to be safe we’re going to run this lesson on two separate halves
of the classroom for your safety.
Because we don’t want her running around going crazy.
Yes, and we have a responsibility to offer schooling to cold-bloodeds too.
Diversity is our highest priority.
Hi, hi!
Organizing this year’s masquerade as a project is super fun, Eric,
but as principal I would have preferred you chose Religion 2.
But I get it.
I was also chair of the party committee just like you, Eric.
Of course you should do it. I remember it like it was yesterday.
Christer Wallgren… Damn, what shoulders and fists.
He got both of them in one grip.
But I’ve got this diversity thing dumped in my lap.
It’s the school board.
And now! What we’ve all been waiting for. A living, breathing female vampire.
Shit, seriously! I’m gonna see if I can get a better shot.
What the hell…?
What the hell…?
–Hi! –Ah!
Oh, sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you.
I’m not really used to being around humans.
Hehe… Me neither.
–Watch out! –Ah!
No, I’m just kidding. We can handle crosses.
Okay. But silver then?
This isn’t real silver.
But what? It cost a fortune!
Kiara Natt och Dag.
Cold… Cold-blooded…
What?
What the hell! You think this is some kind of game? Then get lost!
I’m not taking responsibility for any bloodbath.
Damn it… You don’t want to mess with me, kid.
Stay away!
A cold-blood has started at the school.
So it’s extra relevant right now.
Now it’s important to stroke with the fur. That’s why you’re here, Elise.
As leader of the dance team Batgirls
you traditionally handle the dance performance at the masquerade.
You’re gorgeous! You really are.
It’s hair and long legs and… everything sits where it should.
But I’ll be honest.
It’s perceived as too homogeneous a group
for the Batgirls finale show.
We don’t want the finale show to be perceived that way, obviously.
The school board has decided you need to hold an audition.
An open audition where everyone gets the chance to perform.
I know someone who’s going to be pissed.
Audition?! Fuck that!
Batgirls aren’t just any damn bottom scrap.
But the principal has decided it. I think it’s a good idea.
–No, I refuse. –The principal has a point.
We can’t always pick the most popular girls every time.
Why not?
It’ll be fairer if the best dancers are in.
–As if you’re so damn good then. –Eric, what do you say?
What?
I just think I’m organizing the masquerade
and don’t have anything to do with this.
–No, you’re not going anywhere.
dialogue.speaker: I really have to go now

dialogue.text: I’m obviously in anyway. It’s not me who needs to worry.
Why didn’t you say anything? Well, you were just standing there.
–No time.
dialogue.speaker: I really need to talk to you

dialogue.text: My life has changed. I was literally about to die.
That’s probably super interesting, but I have a bigger problem.
–What does homogay mean?
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Homogay? What the hell are you talking about?
The principal says she needs to see diversity.
She claims Elise and the Batgirls are too homogay.
–That’s what I said, right?
dialogue.speaker: You mean homogeneous

dialogue.text: It’s just cute, blonde girls.
Think a bit more Pick’n’Mix. A brunette wouldn’t hurt.
–Pick’n’Mix? –I don’t have time, Eric.
We can’t let in just any bottom scrap.
Look! There she is.
New girl, sit down.
Yeah, you. Sit.
What brand is that on your bag?
–Nothing I’ve heard of.
dialogue.speaker: What

dialogue.text: Is it expensive?
–Do you think he’s hot? –No. Or who?
So you think Eric is ugly?
Good thing I’m not on my period. Then she might have gotten triggered and eaten me?
–Ew! –Ew!
So, bleach-nose, that’s all.
–That’s your cue. –You can go now.
What does human blood taste like?
Are there vegan vampires?
Maybe that was too personal. –No, it’s fine.
dialogue.speaker: Sorry

dialogue.text: Alfred Carlsson, influencer, vampire researcher.
Vampire researcher? Sexy.
I’ve got a thing for vampires. A fetish.
Or I mean fascination for vampires… like you.
But guys too, though.
But I like girls, I mean. Women, ladies…
–Yeah, you get it –Hi, Alfred.
I get that all of this feels overwhelming,
but you’re in safe hands. I’m going to guide you.
I’m going to teach you everything I can, okay?
The ones you just sat with, that’s the evil side of the dance crew.
Chloe is mad because she thinks she’s the leader of Batgirls.
Over there is the good side and there’s Elise.
She’s the leader of the good side, and that’s why Chloe is mad.
They’re in the dance program.
There’s always drama about who gets to be in
and who doesn’t get to be in Batgirls.
–And who’s that? –Who?
–Oh.
dialogue.speaker: Eric

dialogue.text: My childhood buddy Eric.
Yeah, he’s Mr. Popular these days.
Especially since he and Elise are together.
Oh, they’re together?
–Sometimes?
dialogue.speaker: Sometimes

dialogue.text: Yeah. Depends on how much Eric screws up.
But what? Aren’t there only advantages to being a vampire?
Well…
Don’t forget sunscreen. At least SPF 100.
Always carry your umbrella.
And avoid sweaty environments and people.
And remember, a vampire always speaks the truth
and never goes anywhere unless invited.
You’re sixteen, you’re not a hundred. But you’ve never been to school.
And then over to those four wine regions we talked about:
–Bordeaux, Burgundy, Alsace and…? –Champagne.
Good! Straighten your back! Good.
What? If they finally agreed to let you go to school,
why choose here?
Kiara, we’ve already talked about this. The answer is still no.
Why do you even need to go to school? You’re filthy rich anyway.
–I need 3,400 kr. –I’ll write a check.
Transfer the money to our Swiss bank account.
–900… –Blood and honor.
So if I were to cut myself and bleed a lot,
would you get triggered then?
Yeah, probably.
If I were super hot and sweating a lot, then?
–Okay.
dialogue.speaker: Same

dialogue.text: Super reflexes? No.
Man, what crap, right? Who even wants to go there?
I can’t think of anything I’d rather do than go there.
Exactly! Or what? You want to go?
I want to dance. What do I have to do to join?
Well, to go to the masquerade you just buy a ticket, but…
–No. Dancing, no way.
dialogue.speaker: And dance

dialogue.text: Sign up for the masquerade.
And sign up for the Batgirls audition.
Hey, Affe. How’s it going?
Can’t you sign up for the masquerade, please?
You can’t stay home watching vampire porn again this year.
–Yes, I’d love to.
dialogue.speaker: Do you want to come to the masquerade

dialogue.text: I don’t think we’ve met. Eric, team captain of Skaraborg Bats
and chair of the party committee.
–Are you the new girl?
dialogue.speaker: Kiara Natt och Dag

dialogue.text: –Yeah.
dialogue.speaker: The new girl

dialogue.text: –It’s Countess Kiara Natt och Dag. –Well, look at that.
Then allow me with dignity to invite the countess to a dance at the castle.
I also know cold-bloodeds require an invitation, right?
Okay, Casanova, she gets it.
Elise. –Hi.
dialogue.speaker: Hi

dialogue.text: I’d like to sign up for the masquerade and audition.
Okay, I don’t want to be that person,
but can cold-bloodeds really dance with everyone?
Isn’t it risky with sweat and all that?
–Well, technically. But I’ve got the vamp kit. –Oh, okay. Welcome.
Watch out, Eric!
Cool!
What the hell?
–Damn, that’s cool! –Really.
Are you coming to the party tonight?
No, Dracula Bride. There’s a new season,
so I’m going home to watch it actually.
I wasn’t talking to you.
It’s on the beach, if you want to swing by.
I can’t. My parents won’t let me.
Look. Here she comes.
Did Eric invite you to the beach party?
Yeah, but I can’t.
–Exactly, because you’re not invited. –And vampires aren’t welcome.
The beach party isn’t for just anyone.
I heard you want to audition.
We could use some new blood in Batgirls.
–Yes. Ballet.
dialogue.speaker: Can you dance

dialogue.text: Ballet? Why am I not surprised?
See you at the dance school tomorrow then. Changed and ready.
You can wear ballet clothes.
So, you can go now.
–No, she got the time wrong.
dialogue.speaker: You invited her

dialogue.text: Just like with Linnéa. The one who started crying.
Exactly. That’s not the only thing that makes the bloodsucker cry.
Where’s Kiara? We can’t have another accident, Jacques.
Your sister is your responsibility now.
Kiara…
Give me a K! Give me an Å! Give me an R! What does that make?
Kår! (School spirit cheer)
Ah!
Subtitles: Iyuno for SVT
